headline: My Mom's Swiss Steak
description: This is so easy and all done in one pot! It is delicious and everyone including kids will love it! This recipe is tried and true, impossible to fail! It can also be doubled or tripled without problems, but lower the heat on the second and third batch when browning, as not to burn.
name: My Mom's Swiss Steak

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Place steaks into the pot one at a time, quickly browning on each side. Remove steaks, and set aside. Add the onion to the pot, and cook over medium-low heat until wilted, about 3 minutes. Return the steaks to the pot, and add the tomatoes, mushrooms, celery and green pepper. Season with oregano and add the bay leaf.

Cover the pot, and cook over medium-low heat for about 1 1/2 hours, or until meat is fork tender. If you wish to thicken the gravy, remove the meat to a plate. Stir together the cornstarch and water; stir into the pan juices. Let simmer for about 2 minutes to thicken. Return the beef to the pot.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe!

I made this tonight exactly as written except I used tenderized top round and I didn't have any green bell pepper. It was absolutely delicious and my husband even went back for seconds, which he seldom does! I will definitely be making this again!
Great recipe. Used broth instead of water and cut up steaks and returned them to sauce. Served over egg noodles. Yum.
Yummy with venison! Just added 1T Worchestershire sauce, dredged in flour, and used a mixture of avocado oil and butter to brown the meat. Thank you!!
Even my picky dad enjoyed.

cut meat into serving size pieces. dredge in seasoned flour before browning. at end use sour cream to thicken. I have made this several times. IS A HIT if you use original recipe or update with my changes
Good info for recipes, my rating is ten!!!! 5
this is my go to Swiss Steak recipe. I do add garlic and carrots to the mix and bake it in the oven on 325F for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.
Love this. made few exceptions - for what I had on hand - no mushrooms, crushed tomatoes instead of diced -.and this turned out beautifully. Thanks Janne2 for a great addition to the recipe file
I used beef broth in addition to the canned tomatoes, and it was very good. I did not need to add additional thickening.
This was awful. Used eye of round, and it was so tough we could hardly chew it.

I made a few changes, I used three stalks of celery, added two teaspoons of beef bovril, about a quarter cup of ketchup, I used sirloin tip steaks. If your using a crock pot, allow extra time to tenderize the meat, 5-6 hours, depending on the thickness of the meat. I used stewed and crushed tomatoes
(1 large can of each). This goes very well with mashed potatoes, and Brussel sprouts.

The only thing I changed was..... EVERYTHING!! I'm kidding. I always wondered with all the reviews with edits if anyone has ever been one of those people ^_^ I loved this recipe because I do variations in my slow cooker but this is a very pleasant change up. Only thing I did and always do with beef tips is season flour and brown in my cast iron pan scraping in the bits. Browning keeps the tips super moist by locking in the moisture and gives another flavor element even if you underseason the tips. Thank you.
This recipe was very close to what my mom made when I was growing up.
I will make it again
Wonderful recipe !!!! I made as per recipe and also mashed potatoes ....Yummy

This was pretty amazing! I seasoned and breaded the steaks in flour and fried them in a little oil until browned , added everything to the crock pot and let it cook all day until the steaks were tender. Thickened up nicely without the cornstarch. I used round steaks that were on sale.I used the cup of water and added a spoonful of Better Than Bullion beef. I also used garlic and added a spoonful of cumin. So good! I served it over rice.
I thickened this at the end of cooking by putting about half of the sauce in the blender. It was fabulous.
Made it tonight for dinner! Delicious and easy...served it over basmati rice, will definitely make this again! Keep up the great work. Thanks
When I think of Swiss Steak I actually think of a mushroom cream sauce. But that's just me maybe. This was pretty good. Made it in the dutch oven. Very easy to create.
Good. A little on the bland side for my husband. It still was good but something could have been added to give it a bit more bam!! Not sure what....
Excellent meal. I made it in an electric skillet and let it cook slowly for several hours in order to fit it into our schedule. Leftovers will also be yummy I’m betting.
Made some of the changes recommended ie: floured the meat, added garlic and some extra spices. Ended up just like my Mom's. Hubby had never had Swiss Steak and loved it.

This recipe is awesome - with some additions as noted by others. I seasoned the steak with celery salt, onion powder and garlic powder and then a light coating of flour. To the sauce I added about 2 T of balsamic vinegar, a T of brown sugar, salt, pepper and worcestshire sauce. And by all means dig out your immersion blender at the end. Remove the meat from the pan and whir up about 80% of the sauce, leaving a few nice chunks. You will be amazed what a big difference this makes in the end product.
I made this as written but only to add some hot pepper flakes. I broke up meat a bit and served over baked potato. It was very good. Thanks!
Delicious! You do have to add a little extra seasoning and a little tomato paste but it's delicious and extremely easy. I served it with rice. Second time making it.
Turned out nice the meat was nice I used some of the suggestions on the comments very good reminds me how my mama used to make it
I will flour beef next time, use fire roasted tomatoes, and add beef broth instead of water, and remember to salt and pepper to taste
This was good, and very easy to make, but desperately needs salt!

Easy and tasty! I didn't bother to flour the meat, venison in this case, just browned it. Cooked it on the stove top for about 3 hours and added a bit of red wine as it cooked. The sauce didn't need any thickening at all and was soooooo yummy over rice! I certainly will make this again and share the recipe with my grandson as he just about licked the pot!
Made it in crock pot and just added a can of tomato soup...! Yum ?? Will definitely make it again!!!
I think my Mom had this same recipe. The best!

Pretty much followed recipe with a few additions. Used sirloin but sprinkled with salt pepper and flour and pounded in to tenderize meat. Added carrots along with onions, celery, and green pepper. Used beef broth in place of water and added 2 teas of better than beef bullion beef base which really added depth go flavor. Also used fresh oregano. Also cooked in slow cooker for about 5-6 hours. Husband loved.
Just like my Moms. I added a couple of slices of bacon. Otherwise it was wonderful. It's a keeper and will make again in my crock pot.

5 stars with revisions, 3 stars without. You know when you look at a recipe and it needs a little something, to make it better. For me, I dredged the beef in seasoned flour . I also added beef bouillon instead of water. I used stewed tomatoes, because that's what I had...but it was delicious. I added garlic powder, and a little more salt, and a splash of apple cidar vinegar. The dredged beef thicken the sauce, so I didn't need the corn starch. Very flavorful, enjoyed very much.

I had two 1 inch thick sirloin steaks. Did not dredge in flour just seasoned them raw and. I put in crockpot with 1. Cup beef broth and a can of tomatoes. Seasoned with salt pepper garlic and onion and let slow cook. Thickened up the sauce at the end. Was delicious!! Husband really liked it too!
This was easy and good. I floured the beef before browning, used beef broth and added garlic per other reviewers' recommendations. Served it with brown rice.
This was very tasty, quick and loved by all. This is a 10 in our rating system.
Simple and good! Threw it all in crock pot, added some crushed garlic, and beef broth instead of water. My picky kids even like it!
Easy and delicious. My husband loved it.

I love this recipe. I had this as a child but never had it this good. The changes I made were; I left out the mushrooms, I cut the meat in strips, dusted them with flour and browned them, and after deciding this as a last minute meal idea I cooked it on the stove top instead of the crockpot. It came out so tender and flavorful. I'll definitely be cooking this again.

Nice and easy for sure! I use the thin slices eye of round steaks you can usually find on sale for less then $7 a pack at Safeway... Also did this in a tall sides skillet with a lid stovetop; as long as you cook it long and low heat with fresh ingredients you'll have all the right favors!!!! I did add a dash of white vinegar to the skillet before I closed the lid for a little Peruvian twist because vinegar, tomatoes, and onions together make it hard to resist trust me!!!!
My caregiver and I enjoyed working together to prepare this recipe! I served it with my creamy mashed potatoes and steamed asparagus??
This is a good, basic recipe. Even though I used boxed tomatoes instead of canned, there was a tinny taste. SUGAR solved the problem. I will this recipe again.

I made this 2 nights ago. Absolutely delicious. Was very quick and easy, all in one pot. Very tasty and tender. I did not add the Mushrooms, Celery or the Green Bell Pepper, as I did not have them, but thought that was a little much for swiss steak. I did use top Sirloin steak. We did however really enjoy it, with mashed potatos and gravy. Will certainly make again.

Very much like the Swiss steak my mom used to make. I also added beef broth and a little flour to thicken. I used crushed tomatoes, garlic, onion, celery and fresh mushrooms. I also quartered up a few potatoes. Yummy!
I was surprised by how bland it was.
This was easy to make but lacking in flavor.

Used beef tips dredged in seasoned flour then browned.
Sautéed onion, bell pepper, and celery about 5 minutes.
Added 1/2 cup dry red wine and two cans diced tomatoes.
Added oregano and bay leaf as stated with some season salt.
Added 8 oz. Baby Bella mushrooms.
Simmered 1 hour with lid on pot. Thickened up nicely and had great flavor. Served over white rice. Very good!

This is the closest to what my mother made many many years ago. Just really good. I didnt change anything because to me, it is authentic and I dont want to devalue a wonderful home(Y) recipe and memory. Thank you for posting this.

When I made this the only thing I did differently is used beef broth instead of water and added tomato paste halfway though. By the time it was done it was thick and hearty. It went great served over rice.
Mmmmmm

I just placed it in the crock pot for 6 hours on low! I did not add tomoto, celery, or peppers. And it was great. I guess I just used this recipe as a guideline because I never made swiss steak before. I put it over mashed potatoes. I did coat with flour and browned before I placed meat in crock pot like the recipe stated.

I have made this several times and everyone always loves it. I've served it with rice,egg noodles or mashed potatoes. For lower carb, I serve it with a cauliflower mash. Excellent. It's very easy and I like that it's in one pot. Thank you for sharing.

Made this exactly as written without mushrooms and with out extra water. It was fantastic. Another time I didn't have a bell pepper so I tried it with the mushrooms and it was also fantastic . I make this about once a week, my family loves it.
This is one of the best swiss steak recipes I have tried. Will be a family favorite.

This turned out delish. I cut up and browned sirloin tip steak as suggested by other reviewers. Then sautéed onions and garlic then added the steak back in and covered it with diced tomatoes. Simmered on stove and served over brown rice. Tastes delicious to meandvery easy and quick.

I do not understand the no flavor comments, they must have left something out. So I made it straight up very good. Then made again and I added garlic, fresh basil and oregano, 1/2 cup red wine and 2 beef bouillon cubes. Wow so so good. So if you need more flavor add fresh herbs, garlic and beef broth or bouillon cubes. So so good. I like it better with mashed potatoes than rice. Serve with stir fried vegetable of your choice and peas. Perfect.
Made this for dinner tonight. Tweaked it a little bit and added sliced fresh carrots and fresh herbs. Will definitely make this again. Next time may add a little red wine to add more flavor!
Followed the recipe to the letter and it was amazing.

My mom used to put mozzarella cheese on the steaks just before serving and call this pizza steak. Loved it. I just whirled the tomatoes in blender for a bit bc my family doesn't like big chunks of tomatoes. I did everything else the same and it was great.

I made this just as directed, and it was wonderful. I did not have mushrooms, so I used extra celery. I served it over mashed potatoes. I like that it does not call for flour, because I have a family member who cannot eat gluten, so this was something we could all eat. I will make it again just this way.
Awesome. I used elk steaks instead of beef and it was amazing. Everyone loved it

This recipe was great for a easy week night meal. I only changed a few things, I like others used beef broth in place of the water and also used diced tomato with basil garlic and oregano added so I did not add oregano.

I made this recipe tonight for dinner. SO glad I did. I substituted a few things. I used cube steaks (which I had on hand) and added two cans of Italian stewed tomatoes and one small can of tomato sauce. I omitted the mushrooms because my husband is not a fan of them. Served it over mashed potatoes with a nice green salad. Delicious and will definitely try again.
bread the meat first and thicken with extra flour and add garlic and deglaze with sherry.
Turned out great, added some peppers, onions, and some peppercorn and olive oil tomatoes!
Tom likes it. Left over sauce can be used for Chicken Spaghetti.... or to cook chicken breasts.

I followed a reviewers suggestion and used some beef broth so it would have enough moisture to cook. Turns out that was way too much. Next time I think I will only use a quarter cup. I do love the taste I must say. It's been more than 20 years since I've had Swiss steak and this is a great recipe to follow. Also, I had some boxed "potatoes al gratin" that needed to be cooked so that was the side. Hope Mike likes this.
Simple meal! Definitely agree it needs major flavor! We added lots of garlic and salt to get it with some decent flavor.
I'd like to try this recipe but hubby isn't allowed tomatoes. Has anyone tried it with mushroom soup and onions as a base?
I'd like to try this recipe but hubby isn't allowed tomatoes. Has anyone tried it with mushroom soup and onions as a base?

I made this for hubby and kids this wknd. I started with the recipe as written. Even after adding countless spices and a can of Chiles it was so bland I ended up scraping off the tomato mixture and making home made gravy to salvage the leftovers. I'll not make this again.

Great basic recipe. Just like my mother made. Remembering that mom's recipe was plain, I followed suggestions from other reviews. Used what I had,Italian style diced tomatoes (Hunts), canned mushrooms, 1\2 c beef broth and Italian seasoning. Simmered for 70 minutes. Served over brown rice. Husband loved it! Will make this again.

Sauce was very tasty but the meat was not very flavorful even after following many of the tips from other reviewers. I seasoned the meat before flouring and browning, added lots of garlic, other seasonings before cooking and it was disappointing.
Used beef broth instead of water, added some minced garlic, and browned the steak (in flour and spices) first.

Since canned diced tomatoes have no flavor, IMO, I replaced them with two cups crushed San Marzano tomatoes. I also omitted the oregano since I didn't want an "Italian" taste (that's not traditional for Swiss Steak). I added about a tablespoon of Worcestershire to the sauce while it cooked instead. Had no celery on hand so I seasoned the steaks well with celery salt and black pepper before browning them, as well as adding a bit of salt and pepper to taste while this cooked. Turned out very good.

The good? The steaks got very tender, fork tender, in fact. The sauce and vegetables were really good too. The "meh", however, was that the steaks were quite flavorless. I followed the recipe exactly, except that I lightly floured the steaks before browning them, after a light application of salt and pepper. My husband was underwhelmed, sad to say, and so was I, after such a long cooking time.
Very very good! I do the same recipe with a pot roast and it is always tender. I add a tablespoon of sugar and white vinegar to the mix and serve with piping hot mashed potatoes. Yum.

Wonderful oldfashioned Swiss Steak!! Gave it 4 stars because I did add a can of beef broth, browned the floured steak in EVO,in my Dutch oven, then added everything else and baked at 275 for about 3 hours--perfect!!! Did not have to thicken further. Served over mashed potatoes, and then made the whole thing into a Shepherd's Pie for another meal.
Very good!
Great recipe -truly just like mom used to make! My husband loved it. I even made it for my mom and dad - they both thought it was just as good as mom's - and hers is pretty terrific!
I made this and loved it. I did not change a thing except I had frozen peppers and they worked wonderful.

I actually used this recipe as inspiration to clean out the fridge! Had cooked strip steak & grilled mushrooms leftover, as well as parts of onions & bell pepper, & even a small amount of homemade marinara which I used in place of the canned diced tomatoes. Served it over leftover pasta but I could definitely see it over mashed potatoes or rice also. Very good & flavorful comfort food. And as an added bonus I have a clean fridge too!
my mother in law made this when I was still dating my husband. I'm so glad I found this recipe. It was so good.

I tried this recipe as my husband loves swiss steak. It was delicious. I used a can of onion/green pepper petite-diced canned tomatoes, cut up some green pepper and onions and cooked them in the skillet after browning the beef. I added some water and a beef boullion cube and let the veggies simmer until done. I baked the swiss steak at 325 for 2 hours. It was tender and made a great gravy for my mashed potatoes.
Was just like mom used to make! Even my picky eaters liked it. For them I left out the mushrooms, but added some fresh sliced to mine. Yummy!

this is the best. made it a few days ago and it turned out great. i had some left so i made a second batch and combined them and turned it into beef stew. it makes a great base for beef stew also. everyone wanted the recipe. i did add a pint of tomato juce and cabbage to the fist batch when i made it. the cabbage made the difference.

This was yummy. I made a few small changes, though. I dredged the sirloin strips in seasoned flour and browned first, then adding beef stock to the pan before adding the vegetables. If I had time, I would have let it simmer for much longer to tenderize the beef, but it was still good.

This was absolutely fantastic! My husband raved about it and my picky children gobbled it right up. I will definitely make this again. I seasoned the steak with all purpose seasoning and dredged it in flour before browning it. I added a cup of beef broth in place of the water. I omitted the bay leaf because I didn't have any and since I floured the steak the cornstarch wasn't necessary. I also added garlic because I add garlic to just about everything. YUMMY!
I made this for a weekly food share participate in with 2 other families and HOLY COW WAS IT A HIT!
This recipe was the first Swiss Steak I had ever tried and LOVED it.

This was very good. It was different than I'm use to for Swiss Steak but the flavors were very good. My family enjoyed it and recommends that I make it again. This will be a recipe that I will be making again and again.
Made it in my slow cooker today. Fantastic!

OUTSTANDING!!!!!!
I thickened the gravy as previously noted.
Serve with egg noodles or macaroni :-)

I browned the meat and then added the onion (and garlic) as it was finishing. I mashed a 28 oz can of whole peeled tomatoes, and then added them to the pot. I used salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning, stirred, and then let it simmer for 2 hours. The meat was so tender. I served over mashed potatoes and we all gobbled it up. Delicious!
This is so great. Super easy, and best with all the optional items. Though we don't thicken the sauce. My kids love it with rice....
Love this recipe came out perfect!I didn't have green pepper but used celery.Smiling at how delish this dish tastes!
I like it cause it's always harder to find beef slow cooker meals, it was pretty tasty too.
